title: Paramythion tvvo treatises of the comforting of an afflicted conscience, written by M. Richard Greenham, with certaine epistles of the same argument. Heereunto are added two sermons, with certaine graue and wise counsells and answeres of the same author and argument.
author: Greenham, Richard.
publisher: By Richard Bradocke, for Robert Dexter, and are to be solde at the signe of the Brasen Serpent in Paules Churchyard,
notes: A revised edition, with additions, of: A most sweete and assured comfort for all those that are afflicted in conscience, or troubled in minde.
First word of title in Greek characters.
The first sermon is reprinted from his: Two learned and godly sermons: London, 1595.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
